    • Method Detail

      • refineThis

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> refineThis(java.lang.String[] rawList)
        Take in an array of strings and returns an ArrayList of strings with whitespace and the closing semicolon removed.
        Parameters:
        rawList - An array of strings containing trimmed and split strings from a bibTex file. The list you are meant to pass into here is the one that is returned from the method called preProcess().
        Returns:
        returns null if you passed in an empty list, and if all goes according to plan, will return an ArrayList of strings that has gotten rid of empty spaces, extraneous white space, and the final semicolon.

      • preProcess

        public static java.lang.String[] preProcess(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file - Takes in a file object which should point to a bibTex file. It will check first if the file might be one of the json files created by this program and avoid manipulating those.
        Returns:
        Once it takes in a file, it will break that file down into smaller strings and return an array of strings containing the split pieces. This is directly meant to be passed into the refineThis() method. Take in a file and as long as it's not one of the created files, split it up and return an array of cleaned strings. This is meant to be sent into the refineThis() method.

      • createFiles

        public static void createFiles(java.lang.String givenAuthorName,
                               java.util.ArrayList<authorbib.Article> curatedMasterList)
        Take in an author name, and an ArrayList of Article objects that has already been filled with the searched author name, and create the required files.
        Parameters:
        givenAuthorName - This is the surname of an author that will be used to name the json files.
        curatedMasterList - This is a pre-searched ArrayList of Article objects that will be used to create the json output of this program.

      • authorSearch

        public static java.util.ArrayList<authorbib.Article> authorSearch(java.util.ArrayList<authorbib.Article> masterList,
                                                                  java.lang.String givenAuthorName)
        Pass in the master list of Articles, and the author name and this method will search all of the articles for the requested author and return a new ArrayList containing just the articles with the requested author.
        Parameters:
        masterList - This is an ArrayList containing all of the found articles from all of the bibTex files.
        givenAuthorName - This is the desired surname of an author. This name will be searched in the master list to return the result.
        Returns:
        The method will return a new ArrayList of articles which will contain only those articles that have been found to contain the surname of the desired author.

      • processBibFiles

        public static void processBibFiles(java.util.ArrayList<authorbib.Article> curatedMasterList,
                                   java.io.File iEEE,
                                   java.io.File acm,
                                   java.io.File nj)
        Pass in the curated master list, as well as the 3 files, and this method will use a printWriter to output the article information from the ArrayList to the proper files with the correct formatting.
        Parameters:
        curatedMasterList - This is the pre-searched ArrayList that you can get when you run the authorSearch() method.
        iEEE - the file object which points to the already created IEEE file.
        acm - the file object which points to the already created ACM file.
        nj - the file object which points to the already created NJ file.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
